p: The optimization of the chromatographic parameters by CCD experimental design allowed an investigation of three independent variables (factors) at five levels with only N = 2 3 + 2 x 3 + 1 = 15 experiments, while a full-factorial design with three variables would require N = 5 3 = 125 experiments [ 29]. Furthermore, the PFP stationary phase provided enhanced dipole–dipole interactions, π–π interactions, charge–transfer interactions, and ion–exchange interactions compared to C18 or C8 phases [ 30, 31]. Hence, the developed novel analytical method, based on experiment 5, enabled a selective quantification of α-KBA, β-KBA, α-AKBA, and β-AKBA for the first time ( Figure 5b).
